member.summary: Indicates the number value.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ConditionalFormattingValueType.Percent
member.summary: The minimum value in the range of cells that the conditional formatting rule applies to plus X percent of the difference between the maximum and minimum values in the range of cells that the conditional formatting rule applies to.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ConditionalFormattingValueType.Max
member.summary: The maximum value from the range of cells that the conditional formatting rule applies to.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ConditionalFormattingValueType.Min
member.summary: The minimum value from the range of cells that the conditional formatting rule applies to.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ConditionalFormattingValueType.Formula
member.summary: The result of the formula determines the minimum or maximum value of the cell range that the rule applies to. If the result is not numeric, it is treated as zero.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ConditionalFormattingValueType.Percentile
member.summary: The minimum value of the cell that is in the X percentile of the range of cells that the conditional formatting rule applies to.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ConditionalFormattingValueType.AutoMin
member.summary: The smaller of zero or the minimum value from the range of cells that the conditional formatting rule applies to.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ConditionalFormattingValueType.AutoMax
member.summary: The larger of zero or the maximum value from the range of cells that the conditional formatting rule applies to.

member.summary: Treats empty worksheet cells in a data series as zero values, so that the line drops to zero for zero-value data points.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.Chart.EmptyValueStyle.Connect
member.summary: Instead of leaving gaps for empty worksheet cells in a data series, the gaps are filled with a connecting element.

members.member:
Merges the Border object passed in with the current object. Each property is copied from the passed in object to the current object only if the corresponding property in the current object is NOT defined.
Merges settings of the specified Border object with the current border.
Object whose settings are merged with the current border

Merges the Border object passed in with the current object. If force is true, each property is copied from the passed in object to the current object if the property is defined within the passed in object. If force is false, each property is copied from the passed in object to the current object only if the corresponding property in the current object is NOT defined.
Merges settings of the specified Border object with the current border with the option to force a merge if the settings are defined in the current border.
Object whose settings are merged with the current border Whether settings are overridden in the current border

member.summary: [1024] Includes the DefaultFilterItem implementation of IFilterItem in the drop-down list

member.summary: [1025] Uses the default filter behavior and sorts the drop-down list alphabetically

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.FilterListBehavior.SortByMostOccurrences
member.summary: [1032] Sorts the drop-down list by the number of times an item occurs from most to least

member.summary: [1040] Sorts the drop-down list by the number of times an item occurs from least to most

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.FilterListBehavior.SortNoSort

members.member:
The DefaultFilter implementation of the ICustomFilterItem interface. This class performs Excel-like filtering by hiding rows that do not meet the filter criteria. In addition, the DefaultFilter can filter by applying a filtered-in style or filtered-out style to each row based on whether the row item meets the filter criteria.
Represents the default filtering of rows based on specified criteria.

members.member:
The operator stack holds unary prefix operators, binary infix operators, functions, commas, and left parentheses until their corresponding operands are parsed. The expression stack holds sub-expressions while the text is being parsed.
Converts the string to an Expression object.
String to convert Base row position Base column position Whether to use R1C1 notation Table of custom functions Table of custom names Array list of data models

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.MergePolicy
member.summary: Specifies how the control handles automatic merging of cells based on the values in the cells.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.MergePolicy.None
member.summary: Never automatically merges cells

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.MergePolicy.Always
member.summary: Always automatically merges neighboring cells with identical values

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.MergePolicy.Restricted
member.summary: Automatically merges cells neighboring cells with identical values if the corresponding cells in another row or column are similarly merged

member.name: M:FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.CellRangeCollectionHelper.Union(System.Collections.Generic.List{FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.CellRange},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unites all the cell ranges which are adjoined or intersected. This method uses the unionRowsFirst parameter. The method starts by joining the adjoining or intersected cellranges which have the same row and row count (or column and column count), then joining the adjoining or intersected cell ranges which have the same column and column count (or row and row count). All cell ranges that are inside other cell ranges are removed. The method loops until no cell range can be united.
member.param: Indicates whether to join cell ranges with the same row and row count or the same column and column count first
member.returns: true if there are cell ranges to be joined

member.name: M:FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.CellRangeCollectionHelper.UnionAlongRows(System.Collections.Generic.List{FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.CellRange})
member.summary: Unites all the cellranges which are adjoining or intersected. The method unites the adjoining or intersected cellranges which have same column and column count
member.returns: true if there are cellranges that be united

member.name: M:FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.CellRangeCollectionHelper.UnionAlongColumns(System.Collections.Generic.List{FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.CellRange})
member.summary: Unites all the cellranges which are adjoining or intersected. The method unites the adjoining or intersected cellranges which have same row and row count
member.returns: true if there are cellranges that be united

member.name: M:FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.CellRangeCollectionHelper.CompareCellRangeColumnFirst(FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.CellRange,FarPoint.Web.Spread.Model.CellRange)
member.summary: Compare two cellranges. Compare the cell range with the order following: column, row, columnCount, rowCount. If two cellranges have same row and column, the cellrange which has bigger rowCount/columnCount will be considered being lesser. This is necessary for the logic of UnionAlongRows method
member.returns: value that indicates the comparision between two cell ranges

member.summary: Represents the partial (abstract) implementation of the ISheetStyleModel interface for a style model for a sheet.

members.member:
Determines whether the model has no style settings.
This implementation always returns true.

Gets the style information as a composite of settings for the specified cell, column, row, or model default.
This implementation does nothing and returns null.
Row index of the cell in the model, or -1 to specify an entire column or the model default
Column index of the cell in the model, or -1 to specify an entire row or the model default
Alternating row index of the cell, or -1 to skip composing any alternating style
Destination StyleInfo object for composing the styles; if null, then a new StyleInfo should be created and used

Gets the direct style information for the specified cell, column, row, or model default.
This implementation does nothing and returns null.
Row index of the cell in the model, or -1 to specify an entire column or the model default
Column index of the cell in the model, or -1 to specify an entire row or the model default
Destination StyleInfo object for getting the style; if null, then a new StyleInfo should be created and used

Sets the direct style information for the specified cell, column, row, or model default.
This implementation does nothing.
Row index of the cell in the model, or -1 to specify an entire column or the model default
Column index of the cell in the model, or -1 to specify an entire row or the model default
Source StyleInfo object that has style information

Sets the specified alternating row style in the model.
This implementation does nothing and returns null.
Index of the alternating row style to set; must be between 0 and AltRowCount-1
Source StyleInfo object that has style information

member.value: true if date axis; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.DisplayEmptyCellsAs
member.summary: Gets or sets what to display empty cells as.
member.value: The display empty cells as value.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.DisplayHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether data in hidden cells is plotted for the sparklines in this sparkline group.
member.value: true to display data in hidden cells; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.DisplayXAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the horizontal axis is displayed for each sparkline in this sparkline group.
member.value: true to display the horizontal axis; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.ShowFirst
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the first data point is formatted differently for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.FirstMarkerColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the first data point for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the date range for the sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.ShowHigh
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the data points with the highest value are formatted differently for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.HighMarkerColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the highest data point for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.ShowLast
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the last data point is formatted differently for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.LastMarkerColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the last data point for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.LineWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the line weight for each sparkline in the sparkline group, where the line weight is measured in points. The weight must be greater than or equal to zero, and must be less than or equal to 3 (LineSeries only supports a line weight value in the range of 0.0->3.0).

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.ShowLow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the data points with the lowest value are formatted differently for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.LowMarkerColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the lowest data point for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.ManualMax
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum for the vertical axis that is shared across all sparklines in this sparkline group. The value must be zero if maxAxisType does not equal custom.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.ManualMin
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum for the vertical axis that is shared across all sparklines in this sparkline group. The value must be zero if minAxisType does not equal custom.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.ShowMarkers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether data markers are displayed for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.MarkersColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the color of the data markers for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.MaxAxisType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how the vertical axis maximums for the sparklines in this sparkline group are calculated.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.ExcelSparklineSetting.MinAxisType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how the vertical axis minimums for the sparklines in this sparkline group are calculated.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the negative data points are formatted differently for each sparkline in this sparkline group.

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Spread.CommandBar
member.summary:
Summary description for CommandBar. Command button layout
For upper level browser
1. Operation Mode = Normal | Update | Cancel | Copy | Paste | Cut | Insert(optional) | Delete(optional) | Next(optional) | Prev(optional) |
2. Operation Mode = RowMode | Update | Cancel | Insert(optional) | Delete(optional) | Next(optional) | Prev(optional) |
3. Operation Mode = ReadOnly/SingleSelect | Next(optional) | Prev(optional) |
For down level browser 1. Operation Mode = RowMode or Operation Mode = Normal | Edit | Update | Cancel | Insert(optional) | Delete(optional) | Next(optional) | Prev(optional) |
2. Operation Mode = ReadOnly/SingleSelect | Next(optional) | Prev(optional) |
For RenderEditors mode | Update | Cancel | Next(optional) | Prev(optional) |

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Spread.OperationMode
member.summary: Specifies how the sheet responds to user interaction and how selection behaves.

members.member:
Performs default sheet operations
Allows users to perform default spreadsheet selecting and editing

Sets a sheet to read-only mode; within this mode, there is no currently active cell
Allows users to see the data but not to select or edit any cell or row in the sheet

Allows users to select rows in a sheet, and edit individual cells in rows by double-clicking a cell
Allows users to select (highlight) a single row only and to edit an individual cell in that row

Allows users to select a single row in a sheet, similar to a single-selection list box
Allows users to select (highlight) a single row only but not to edit any cell

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.OperationMode.MultiSelect
member.summary: Allows the user to select multiple contiguous rows in the spreadsheet (as one would in a multiple-select list box)

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.OperationMode.ExtendedSelect
member.summary: Allows the user to select multiple discontiguous rows in the spreadsheet (as one would in an extended-select list box)

member.summary: Displays the page navigation aids in a bar at the top of the Spread component

member.summary: Displays the page navigation aids in a bar at the bottom of the Spread component and below a command bar (if shown)

member.summary: Displays the page navigation aids on the command bar

member.summary: Displays the page navigation aids at the top and bottom of the Spread component in two separate bars

member.summary: Displays the page navigation aids in a bar at the top of the Spread component and on the command bar

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.CursorType.AllScroll
member.summary: all-scroll Only supported by Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrows pointing up, down, left, and right with a dot in the middle, indicating that the page can be scrolled in any direction.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.CursorType.ColResize
member.summary: col-resize Only supported by Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating them, indicating that the item/column can be resized horizontally.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.CursorType.RowResize
member.summary: row-resize Only supported by Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them, indicating that the item/row can be resized vertically.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.CursorType.NoDrop
member.summary: no-drop Only supported by Internet Explorer 6 and later. Hand with a small circle with a line through it, indicating that the dragged item cannot be dropped at the current cursor location.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.CursorType.NotAllowed
member.summary: not-allowed Only supported by Internet Explorer 6 and later. Circle with a line through it, indicating that the requested action will not be carried out.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.CursorType.Progress
member.summary: progress Only supported by Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrow with an hourglass next to it, indicating that a process is running in the background. User interaction with the page is unaffected.

member.name: F:FarPoint.Web.Spread.CursorType.VerticalText
member.summary: vertical-text Only supported by Internet Explorer 6 and later. Editable vertical text, indicated by a horizontal I-bar.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.FpSpread.RenderCSSClass
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Spread component should render the styles by using CSS styles or by using in-line style attributes.
member.remarks: Gets or sets whether the Spread component should render the styles, such as BackColor, ForeColor, Font, etc., by using cascading style sheet (CSS) styles or by using in-line style attributes. The default is to use the in-line style attributes. If this property is true, the Spread component renders the styles as CSS styles. That reduces the page size and speeds up loading the ASPX page. When this property is true, the Spread component checks if a cell renderer supports the ICSSClassSupport interface. If the cell renderer supports the ICSSClassSupport interface and the CssClass property of the cell renderer is null or empty string, the Spread component renders the style for the cell as a CSS style; otherwise, the Spread component renders the style as in-line style attributes.

members.member:
Gets or sets the position of the expand and collapse image in the Spread component.
The image can be to the right or left of the text.

Gets or sets whether to access the Clipboard with client-side scripting.
IE7 will show a warning message when Spread client script is accessing the Clipboard. To avoid the issue, you could ask users to change their IE settings or you can set this property to false. When this property is false, Spread will not access Clipboard on the client script. The copy and paste operation will work inside Spread. You will not be able to copy the data from Spread to other applications or copy data from other applications to Spread.

Loads formulas that are deserialized during deserialization, but, not parsing yet. This method is called after all the sheets have been created and deserialized.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.SheetView.LoadOnDemandTriggerMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the LoadOnDemandTriggerMode property. If trigger mode is Timed, spread loads the next set of rows after a period of time until there are no rows to load. If trigger mode is OffsetBased, spread only loads the next set of rows if the user scrolls to the row at the position.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Spread.SheetView.LoadOnDemandMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the LoadOnDemandMode property. In Standard mode, spread loads the next set of rows, if after scrolling, there are no bottom rows (in the view) that are hidden. In Background mode, spread loads the next set of rows after a period of time or after the user scrolls to the row at the position.

members.member:
The default value for the PageMaxAlign property is false. When the PageMaxAlign property is set to true, the last page displays the PageSize of rows. Some of the rows might be displayed in the previous page. When the PageMaxAlign property is set to false, the last page displays only the rows that are not displayed in the previous page.
Gets or sets whether to show the maximum number of rows on the last page.
